results.title: Mirror of Germany. No. 090 = Deutschland Spiegel
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Floods in northern Germany as the dikes break for the first time in 137 years; President de Gaulle talks with Dr. Adenauer; Robert Kennedy visits Berlin; industries and a young theatre in Berlin; a civic centre in Hannover; gokart racing; international equestrian high jump in Dortmund; a slalom race at the end of skiing season.

results.title: Miriam of North Perth
results.creator_credit: Salam Ziusudras and Film and Television Institute (WA)
results.brief_description: A docudrama about a young woman from Iran who finds herself culturally alienated with the Australian way of life. Through her poetic narration she expresses her sense of isolation and loss of identity in this strange and different land. In Farsi with English subtitles.

results.title: Miracle in Minnesota
results.creator_credit: Empire Photosound Inc and Minnesota Theatre Co Foundation
results.brief_description: Traces the development of the Tyrone Guthrie Theatre in Minneapolis, from construction to opening night. Shows the backstage functions of rehearsal, costume work and set building. Includes excepts from Hamlet, The Mixer, Three Sisters and Death of a Salesman.

results.title: Miquette et Sa Mere = Miquette and Her Mother
results.brief_description:
Miquette aspires to be an actress. She runs off with a nobleman who promises to make her a star. When Miquette’s mother searches for her wandering daughter, she finds the girl working with a ragtag touring company. The mother takes a job with the troupe to keep the lecherous nobleman away from Miquette. The film works best as a portrait of a provincial theatre in the 19th century.

Credits: Producer, Paul Joly ; director, Henri-Georges Clouzot ; writer, Henri-Georges Clouzot ; photography, Armand Thirard ; music, Albert Lasry ; art direction, Georges Wakhevitch.
Cast: Louis Jouvet, Bourvil, Daniele Delorme, Mireille Perrey, Saturnin Fabre, Pauline Carton, Paul Barge, Leonce Corne, Jeanne Fusier-Gir, Olivier Hussenot, Philippe Nicaud, Pierre Olaf, Maurice Schutz, Louis Seigner.

results.title: Mint tea = Le The la menthe
results.brief_description: A young man sits on the terrace of a Montparnasse cafe, watching the other patrons as they meet friends, enjoy a drink, flirt, or sit waiting. His own loneliness becomes increasingly apparent against this background of other people, with whom he cannot communicate. French language with some English.

results.title: Minkey
results.creator_credit: Peter Goodall and Western Australia Institute of Technology
results.brief_description: A promotional video for the sport of “Minkey”, a modified form of hockey and part of the Aussie Sports program. Minkey can be played by combined teams of boys and girls on any flat surface and involves a number of individual and team skills.

results.title: Mini movie makers
results.brief_description: Children at the Henry Street Settlement in New York exhibit the efforts of their film club. Two processes were employed: making a film with and without a camera. Firstly, they drew directly on clear film with magic markers, then used paper cutout puppets. Voice-over comments by the children describe their techniques.

results.title: Mini-collectors = Mini collectors
results.creator_credit: Anders Wahlmank and A B Film Teknik
results.brief_description: The film presents young people who collect stamps. Most of them have no interest at all in monetary values and instead collect for the sole reason of fun. They think that it is even greater fun when stamps help them to discover things about other countries of which they had little knowledge before. Many of them like to collect stamps with motifs that interest them such as animals, aircraft and boats.

results.title: Minga: we work together
results.creator_credit: Don Whyte and Reynolds Film Productions
results.brief_description: Presents aspects of the lives of South American Indians living in Northern Ecuador. Shows weaving (which is the main source of income), the sharing of resources within the community, the activities of the town’s market place and the types of housing and diet. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
